prompt: Write a short hero title (6–10 words) for the About page of Starstuck Lab. Tone: dry, poetic, melancholic. Capture the workshop's soul in a few words. Output only the title line.
Write a single subtitle line (10–18 words) that complements the hero title of the About page. Tone: weary curiosity, understated optimism. Output only one sentence.

Write the lead introduction paragraph (2–4 sentences, 40–80 words) for the About page. Describe Starstuck Lab as a loose, zip-tie-held-together workshop where creative things get tinkered with and occasionally escape to find new homes. Tone: poetic, wry, introspective.

Write a reflective essay-style section (80–150 words) titled 'The Philosophy'. Observe what underlies the work that emerges at Starstuck Lab despite entropy. Avoid describing projects. Use metaphors about time, decay, and persistence. Slip in a wordplay joke that causes frustrated laughter if you can think of one (not strictly necessary). End with a poetic one-liner about impermanence.

List 5 short bullet points (6–12 words each) describing projects that emerge from Starstuck Lab: telescopes, weather stations, light controllers, etc. Each bullet should be wry, melancholic, describing the workshop's creations. Output as a Markdown bullet list.
Write a one-line motto (max 12 words) for Starstuck Lab. It should sound like a poetic sigh. Tone: melancholic, resigned hope. Output only the line.
Write a short 3–4 line free verse poem to appear at the bottom of the About page. Theme: creation, futility, stars, and persistence. Keep it subtle and reflective.
